title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Canada is efficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Canada is efficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Belgium has the comparative advantage in the production of beets and/or does not explain that Belgium has the lower opportunity cost in producing beets: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of beets in Belgium is 0.1 unit of carrots and in Canada it is 0.2 unit of carrots.

The response states that Belgium has the comparative advantage in the production of beets and explains that Belgium has the lower opportunity cost in producing beets: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of beets in Belgium is 0.1 unit of carrots and in Canada it is 0.2 unit of carrots.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, Canada will gain from trade and/or does not explain that these terms of trade are greater than Canada’s opportunity cost of producing carrots.
The response states that yes, Canada will gain from trade and explains that these terms of trade are greater than Canada’s opportunity cost of producing carrots.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Canada’s opportunity cost of producing beets will decrease and/or does not explain that it will give up fewer units of carrots to produce each unit of beets.
The response states that Canada’s opportunity cost of producing beets will decrease and explains that it will give up fewer units of carrots to produce each unit of beets.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of employed people in Canada as 36 million and/or does not show the work.

Employed=Labor Force−Unemployed=60 million×75%−60 million×75%×20%=36 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8068@

The response calculates the number of employed people in Canada as 36 million and shows the work.

Employed=Labor Force−Unemployed=60 million×75%−60 million×75%×20%=36 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8068@
